title: Textile, late 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: plain weave foundation; starch paste applied by hand and immersion dyed in indigo (adire)
dimensions: H x W (seamed in middle): 198.1 x 174 cm (6 ft. 6 in. x 5 ft. 8 1/2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description: Narrow horizontal stripe in various shades of blue. The wider bands are patterned with small dots, stars or chevrons, and are separated by two plain bands. The piece is composed of two fabric widths stitched together at the center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, late 20th century.
late 20th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: plain weave foundation; starch paste applied by hand and immersion dyed in indigo (adire). Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund. 1979-23-2.
